English Spanish Additional Languages English Afrikaans Albanian Arabic Armenian Azerbaijani Basque Belarusian Bengali Bosnian Bulgarian Catalan Cebuano Chinese (Simplified) Chinese (Traditional) Croatian Czech Danish Dutch Esperanto Estonian Filipino Finnish French Galician Georgian German Greek Gujarati Haitian Creole Hausa Hebrew Hindi Hmong Hungarian Icelandic Igbo Indonesian Irish Italian Japanese Javanese Kannada Khmer Korean Lao Latin Latvian Lithuanian Macedonian Malay Maltese Maori Marathi Mongolian Nepali Norwegian Persian Polish Portuguese Punjabi Romanian Russian Serbian Slovak Slovenian Somali Spanish Swahili Swedish Tamil Telugu Thai Turkish Ukrainian Urdu Vietnamese Welsh Yiddish Yoruba Zulu Search Golden Colorado Top Picks Documents Full Site Search Top Picks Documents Full Site Search Home Government City Leadership Management Team Management Team City Manager’s Office As the central hub of administrative operations, the City Manager's Office leads the charge in implementing the visions and policies set forth by the City Council. Acting under the authority of our City's Charter, the City Manager serves as the main administrative officer, ensuring the smooth and effective operation of our city government. Duties & Responsibilities Leadership and Oversight: Guided by professional leadership, our office oversees the city's day-to-day operations, coordinating closely with dedicated department directors who bring expertise and innovation to each city function. Strategic Planning :  We're constantly looking ahead, identifying and crafting solutions to meet our community's challenges and opportunities. Whether it's enhancing existing programs or initiating new ones, we're committed to preparing our city for the future. Budgeting for the Future: Each year, the City Manager meticulously prepares a budget proposal, focusing on fiscal responsibility while aiming to meet the community's needs. This proposed budget is then presented to the City Council for review and approval. Engaging with Our Community: We pride ourselves on fostering a sense of pride and trust in city government. Exceptional customer service is not just a goal—it's our standard, ensuring that every interaction reflects our dedication to serving you. Our mission is to translate the City Council's goals into reality, managing resources wisely and working tirelessly to enhance the quality of life for all our residents. City Manager, Scott Vargo (303) 384-8010 svargo@cityofgolden.net Scott Vargo has been City Manager since 2022 and previously served as County Manager and other leadership roles for Summit County since 1999. Deputy City Manager, Carly Lorentz (303) 384-8012 clorentz@cityofgolden.net Carly Lorentz has been Deputy City Manager since 2017 and is responsible for assisting the City Manager in providing leadership and administering the affairs of Golden city government. Prior to her work in Golden, Carly worked for the neighboring City of Wheat Ridge. City Attorney's Office Our mission is to provide excellent legal services that reflect the values and achieve the goals of the City as well as respecting the rights of all people. The City Attorney is appointed by and reports to City Council.  The City Attorney is the legal advisor to City Council, City staff, and all City boards and commissions in matters related to their official powers and duties.  In addition, the City Attorney represents the City in all legal proceedings; drafts all ordinances, resolutions, contracts, and all other legal documents for the City; attends all Council meetings; and performs all services related to the position as required by the City Charter, the ordinances of the City, or the Council. The City Attorney’s Office can not give legal advice to private individuals.  Any person seeking information about his or her individual rights and responsibilities should contact a private attorney, or seek other available legal assistance. City Attorney, Sandra Llanes (303) 597-5212 sllanes@cityofgolden.net Sandra Llanes was appointed by City Council in October 2023.  She is the first in-house attorney for the City, has over twenty years experience in municipal law, and is a long time resident of Golden. City Management Team City Clerk & Court Administrator, Lisa Petersen (303) 384-8005 lpetersen@cityofgolden.net Community Engagement & Communications Director, Meredith Ritchie (303) 384-8132 mritchie@cityofgolden.net Community & Economic Development Director, Rick Muriby (303) 384-8098 rmuriby@cityofgolden.net Finance Director, Matthew Poston (303) 384-8020 mposton@cityofgolden.net Fire Chief, Kasey Beal (303) 384-8090 kbeal@cityofgolden.net Human Resources Director, Kristen Meier (303) 597-5209 kmeier@cityofgolden.net Chief Innovation & Technology Officer, Jiles McCoy (303) 384-8063 jmccoy@cityofgolden.net Parks & Recreation Director, Jeremy Sweat (303) 384-8120 jsweat@cityofgolden.net Police Chief, Joe Harvey (303) 384-8030 jharvey@cityofgolden.net Public Works Director, Anne Beierle (303) 384-8153 abeierle@cityofgolden.net Sustainability Manager, Theresa Worsham (303) 384-8117 tworsham@cityofgolden.net Thriving Communities Director, Sarah Vaine (303) 384-8075 svaine@cityofgolden.net Back to top Didn't find what you were looking for? Accessibility - Golden Lyon Vintage Pub Skip to navigation Skip to main content Skip to footer (opens in a new tab) Accessibility Notice The Riverside Hotel is committed to facilitating the accessibility and usability of its website, www.riversidehotel.com , for all people with disabilities. Working with our website provider, Travelclick, the Riverside Hotel will be implementing over time the relevant portions of the World Wide Web Consortium's Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0 Level AA (WCAG 2.0 AA) as its web accessibility standard or other standards to the extent required by the Americans with Disabilities Act ('ADA"). Our website will be tested on a periodic basis with assistive technology such as screen readers and screen magnifiers, and with users with disabilities who use these technologies. Contact the Riverside Hotel With Your Accessibility Questions: Please be aware that our efforts are ongoing. If, at any time, you have specific questions or concerns about the accessibility of any particular web page on www.riversidehotel.com , please contact us at marketing@riversidehotel.com . If you do encounter an accessibility issue, please be sure to specify the Web page in your email, and we will make all reasonable efforts to make that page accessible for you. Contact Careers Accessibility Notice © Golden Lyon Vintage Pub | Designed by TravelClick , an Amadeus company Golden Lyon Vintage Pub 620 East Las Olas Boulevard, Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301 Phone: (954) 467-0671 © Golden Lyon Vintage Pub | Designed by TravelClick , an Amadeus company

About | Brucan Pubs Home About Pubs Careers Rewards Gifts The Roots of Brucan We build our pubs on our Pillars of Brucan ideology and hold these as core values against everything we do. Our friendly and welcoming service is built on a shared love of hospitality. Our ‘open to all’ policy champions diversity and inclusivity in our teams and guests, never alienating or discriminating. We champion a real living wage and have always ensured the happiness and welfare of our colleagues are upheld with just as much importance as the standards we maintain for our guests. Hospitality is an enormously rewarding way of life. Our passion for providing warm and welcoming pubs for our guests and ensuring that they leave having had the best experiences we can offer never wanes. We love what we do, and that passion is infectious across our teams, who share our desire to be the very best version of ourselves at all times. Our award winning yet accessible food and drink offering uses a network of local and acclaimed suppliers and who share our love for the most amazing artisanal products, both from the UK and the wider global supply chain. Whether it’s a neighbour producing honey in the garden, the finest rare breed meats from our regenerative farming partners in Dorset or the most effervescent of English wines from local vineyards, the suppliers we work with love their trade as much as we love ours, and that makes a huge difference. Leadership Team James Lyon-Shaw Group Director Nick Solomides Recruitment & HR Andrea Richards Events and Marketing Mark Jarvis Operations Manager Doing it Right The BII Sustainability Champion Award is given to hospitality professionals who have gone above and beyond to demonstrate their commitment to running a sustainable business. We are proud to hold this award in all of our pubs and to be part of an environmentally aware award scheme that helps us do things the right way, not because we have to, but because we want to. Community Support Our longstanding partnership with The Windsor Homeless Project enables us to work toward closing the circle on our successes against the backdrop of the challenges faced by others in our community. Through fundraising support, weekly food donations, and work placement opportunities to help bring people back to work in a supportive and structured environment, we aim to serve the whole community, not just those with the means to join us as guests in the pub. Enjoy Deals & Special Offers We’re passionate about great pubs, great people and great produce, and we cannot wait to share our award-winning menus, lovingly crafted daily specials and traditional hospitality with you. Sign up as a Friend of Brucan, and each time you join us in any of our pubs, we’ll keep a digital tally of your visits and reward you in return with discounts, special offers and early bird access to events and promotions. All you have to do is come to any of our pubs and log into the WIFI. The more frequent your visits, the bigger the rewards! Follow Us Terms & Conditions Privacy Policy Modern Slavery Statement Contact Us © 2025 Brucan Pubs James Lyon Shaw Group Director James started his career in Dorset and then stepped things up a gear with a move to London in 2002 to work at the famous Ivy Restaurant. Going on to run many of London’s most well-known gastro pub venues for ETM Group as Operations Director involved opening, designing, project managing and operating venues such at The Botanist, The Gun, The Jugged Hare and Ealing Park Tavern to name just a few. Since launching Brucan Pubs in 2018, James has been the driving force behind finding, refurbishing and launching our venues whilst maintaining a firm hand on the day to day running of the company as Managing Director. His passion for quality, amazing producers and running great pubs is at the heart of all things Brucan. Nick Solomides Recruitment & HR Born in Berkshire and schooled Pangbourne Nick started working in luxury hotels at 16 and fell in love with the industry and went on to complete a degree in hospitality management in 2006 from Oxford Brookes. After graduating Nick spent just a year in hotel management operations in the Cotswolds before realising his passion was in the people and becoming a recruiter to the hospitality industry. In 2010, Nick seized the opportunity to create a bespoke recruitment agency specialising in the supply of chefs to central London kitchens. Involvement in hospitality went full circle when approached by James to join him in starting a pub company, together they launched Brucan Pubs in 2018 with Nick taking lead on recruitment and HR alongside this completing Level 5 CIPD qualification. His integrity, honesty and openness brings an approach to employment and colleague retention that runs through the business at every level. Andrea Richards Events & Marketing Since graduating from the University of Chichester, Andrea has been immersed in the world of weddings and events, beginning her career at the age of 21 at five-star venue in Surrey. Now an experienced event manager, with a passion for creating unforgettable celebrations and fun and effective marketing ideas through the world of social media. Known for her warm, approachable nature, Andrea is always excited to help make each event a joyful and memorable experience and having spent years honing her skills, organizing a wide range of celebrations, from intimate weddings to large-scale corporate events she takes pride in bringing her guest’s visions to life and ensuring that every detail is perfect. Mark Jarvis Operations Manager After leaving Bristol and heading to Surrey as an eager bar tender, a part-time job turned into a passion and love for all things hospitality. With over 18 years' experience including celebrity chef backed restaurants and pubs, working in all areas of the industry Mark has gained an eye for detail a passion for training and development alongside a wealth of drinks knowledge. After joining Brucan Pubs in May 2021 at the second venue, Mark became instrumental in the growth and stability of the group as he progressed into the Operations Manager role.
